title: Community outbreak might start from Sai Wan Ho

replies.msg:
Two more people in Hong Kong have been confirmed to be infected with Wuhan coronavirus, bringing up to total number to 38.

The 38th case is a 69-year-old man who is chronically ill and had not travelled outside Hong Kong in the past 14 days. He began coughing on January 30 and visited a private doctor on Friday.

He was admitted to the Pamela Youde Nethersole Eastern Hospital on 9th February after having breathing difficulties and now requires intubation.

His wife and mother-in-law have also tested positive initially. They live together in Sai Wan Ho.

Just 3 days passed, and there are 4 cases appeared in Sai Wan Ho
1. The 23th and 38th cases are confirmed diagnosis;
2. The 37th and 38th cases are from the same flat, but they are initial diagnosed.

Similarities between the four cases are the distance of their flats is only across a street, which only takes within a minute to go there.

On the other hand, the 16th case had been to the church in Sai Wan Ho in last January, and just now (11/2/2020) there's a notice from the Incorporated Owners of the Tai On Building saying that there is a new case appeared on the 7th floor in their building.

Concerns:
1. Sai Wan Ho might going to have a community outbreak and it wouldn't rule out that there will be cases increase in this small area.

2. All confirmed diagnosis don't have a record of travelling over the past 14 days (infected locally), which creates a concern that there might be invisible chains of infection happening in Sai Wan Ho and have not been traced yet.
